> The problem is that ClassDefNotFoundError is usually (in my
> experience) thrown as a result of an error in a static
> initializer.

That's one possibility. Another is a missing class file. Really.

> After all, it found the class (which is why you
> haven't seen a ClassNotFoundException), but it can't load it.

And therefore couldn't create the class *definition* from it, and therefore
can't find it. At least that sounds like a possible explanation of what
might happen.

Cheers, Ilja
